Rebased on top of master.
@amitsela PTAL
@ssisk by the way, I started to prepare IT on others IO (already started JMS, MQTT, ...).

Just for the record, don't forget to add the Jira id in the commit message.

I do it for you with `git commit --amend`.

Thanks !
Thanks a lot @dhalperi , @ssisk , @jbonofre , @iemejia  for your comments . Working on them.

@dhalperi I understand the concerns you raise. I'll try to address them from my point of view.

> 1. Extra executions for modules that don't depend on Guava. This will slow the build.

Many of the modules already shade, so regarding slowing down of the build I’m not sure this concern is that pertinent if new way of shading is an improvement.

> 2. Modules that need to shade more than just Guava will have to override the shading config. They may 
> actually get it wrong after that, so Guava might still be exposed. -- Thus, while this reduces the amount of config necessary in common cases, does guarantee solution.

I agree that human error could cause Guava to be forgotten from shading configuration added to child modules, but is this different than today? Can this human error not happen now?

R: @bjchambers 
CC: @staslev @iemejia

The goal of these PR is basically to improve the doc and to fix the correct use of these tests categories in the existing IOs.
The first part I think is already clear and I will improve the docs taking the ideas from Stas comments. The second part however is still not clear for me, what do you think? should the IOs don't have any category annotation? or which of the three options I presented before makes sense?

>  test is a problem to check values of timestamp with one piece of code, as this field is only available in client 0.10. Any examples as refer

For now, we can just verify default timestamp behavior (but that is already tested I think). I haven't looked into specifically but we will have to use similar runtime reflection in test too. For now, it is ok to leave it alone.

@tgroh I think you only changed the streaming translator for Spark. Unfortunately there's also a separate batch translator, and you'd be looking for [this](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/runners/spark/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/spark/translation/TransformTranslator.java#L334).
Run Spark RunnableOnService
I'm assuming the ROS tests for Spark will break because of the missing changes for batch.

This is unfortunately going to conflict heavily with #2145.
Run Dataflow RunnableOnService
Run Apex RunnableOnService
I'm aware of that PR and I think the conflicts won't be *that* bad. I'm fine submitting mine later and dealing with the conflicts - still worth a review for whether the proposed changes make sense.
In fact, I think this would break wordcount. But best to be thorough.

From the high level description, it makes sense. I would consider inlining `ParDo.MultiOutput` to `ParDo` (no need for it to just be a namespace) since it is the true primitive but that's really a matter of style. I think the SDK tends not to do that.
